definition: Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
(bound form) army/military
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
surname Wei
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
Central Military Committee (CMC)
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee/same as 軍委|军委

sentences.english: This is a matter of strategic policy, and I hope the Military Commission will discuss it.
sentences.chinese: 這是戰略方針的問題，希望軍委討論一下。

sentences.english: The use of vehicles equipped with sirens will be rigorously controlled during official visits in order to prevent public disturbances.
sentences.chinese: 爲了避免擾民，軍委同志出訪時，嚴格控制使用警車。

sentences.english: It is under the absolute leadership of the Central Military Commission.
sentences.chinese: 中央軍委有關軍隊的調動指揮是通過總參來執行的。

sentences.english: This is a significant move, which was approved by the State Council, which is the cabinet, and the Central Military Commission.
sentences.chinese: 這是得到國務院和中央軍委所批准的重大舉措。

sentences.english: The commission assigned the academy the task of building these missiles.
sentences.chinese: 中央軍委賦予五院研製這些導彈的任務。

sentences.english: What before us were the offices of the Central Military Committee during the war.
sentences.chinese: 現在展現在大家眼前的是軍委作戰室。

sentences.english: The CMC ordered them to quickly turn to Jiao-Ping across the river.
sentences.chinese: 軍委命令他們迅速轉到皎平渡過江。

sentences.english: CMC has been working with Oerlikon since the optical media days.
sentences.chinese: 中央軍委一直與厄利空以來，光學媒體天。

sentences.english: In theory, the commission's chairman is elected by the National People's Congress.
sentences.chinese: 理論上，中央軍委主席由全國人民代表大會選舉。

definition: Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
chief of staff
Central Military Committee (CMC)
commander
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Luo Ronghuan (1902-1963), Chinese communist military leader
army rank/military rank
Xiang Ying (1898-1941), communist general involved in forming the New Fourth Army 新四軍, killed in 1941 during the New Fourth Army incident 皖南事变
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
political commissar (during Russian and Chinese communist revolutions)
He Long (1896-1969), important communist military leader, died from persecution during the Cultural Revolution
army grouping/collective army
Central Committee
(military) Chief of Staff
